tool.name: UCSC BLAT Alignment Tool
tool.command:
#if str($reference_source.reference_source_selector) == "history": ## blat depends on file extension #if $reference_source.database.is_of_type("fasta"): #set $reference_fasta_filename = "localref.fa" #elif $reference_source.database.is_of_type("twobit"): #set $reference_fasta_filename = "localref.2bit" #else #set $reference_fasta_filename = "localref" #end if
ln -s '${reference_source.database}' '${reference_fasta_filename}' && #else: #set $reference_fasta_filename = str($reference_source.database.fields.path) #end if
blat #if $noHead == "yes" -noHead #end if
-q=$query_type -t=$database_type
#if $mask_type.mask == "file.out": -mask='${mask_type.mask_file}' #else: -mask=$mask_type.mask #end if
'$reference_fasta_filename' '${query}'
output && sort -k 10,10 -k 12,12n output > '${output_sorted}'

param.name: reference_source_selector
param.label: Choose the source for the database

validator.message: A built-in database is not available

param.name: database
param.label: Using database file, either a .fa, .nib or .2bit file

param.name: query
param.label: Query data, either a .fa, .nib or .2bit file

param.name: database_type
param.label: database type
param.help: Choose your database type, the default is dnax
param.option: dnax - DNA sequence translated in six frames to protein

param.name: query_type
param.label: query type
param.help: Choose your query type, the default is rnax
param.option: dnax - DNA sequence translated in six frames to protein
rnax - DNA sequence translated in three frames to protein

param.name: noHead
param.label: Suppresses .psl header (so it's just a tab-separated file).

param.name: mask
param.label: Mask out repeats
param.help: Alignments won't be started in masked region but may extend through it in nucleotide searches. Masked areas are ignored entirely in protein or translated searches. Default is lower
param.option: out - mask according to database.out RepeatMasker .out file
file.out - mask database according to RepeatMasker file.out

tool.help:
BLAT ==== BLAT is a bioinformatics software a tool which performs rapid mRNA/DNA and cross-species protein alignments.
blat (version: v340)- Standalone blat sequence search command line tool. -------------------------------------------------------------------------
usage: ++++++
$ blat database query [-ooc=11.ooc] output.psl
where: database and query are each either a .fa, .nib or .2bit file, or a list of these files with one file name per line. -ooc=11.ooc tells the program to load over-occurring 11-mers from an external file. This will increase the speed by a factor of 40 in many cases, but is not required. output.psl is the name of the output file.
documentation: ++++++++++++++
See Blat documentation (http://genome.ucsc.edu/goldenPath/help/blatSpec.html)
Source code: ++++++++++++
http://hgdownload.cse.ucsc.edu/admin/exe/
